Euro 2016|2016 France]]|}} | club-update = 07:58, 24 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 November 2018 }} '''Hugo Hadrien Dominique Lloris''' ({{IPA-fr|yɡo joʁis}}; born 26 December 1986) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] and is the [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of both English club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[France national football team|French national team]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://aol.sportingnews.com/soccer/story/2012-02-28/hugo-lloris-named-as-frances-euro-2012-captain |title=Hugo Lloris named as France's Euro 2012 captain |work=[[Sporting News]] |date=28 February 2012 |accessdate=28 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120711223900/http://aol.sportingnews.com/soccer/story/2012-02-28/hugo-lloris-named-as-frances-euro-2012-captain |archivedate=11 July 2012}}</ref> Lloris is described as a goalkeeper who "boasts lightning reflexes and good decision-making" and is "a formidable opponent in one-on-one situations". Lloris also "commands his box well".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/43372/hugo-lloris?cc=5901 |title=Hugo Lloris ESPN Profile |accessdate=4 April 2011 |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}</ref> His playing style, and in particular his speed when coming off his line to anticipate opponents and clear the ball, has led him to be described as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)#Sweeper-keeper|sweeper-keeper]] in the media.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wilson |first1=Jonathan |title=Tottenham's Hugo Lloris is Premier League's supreme sweeper-keeper |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/feb/13/tottenham-hugo-lloris-premier-league-sweeper-keeper |accessdate=11 May 2017 |work=The Guardian |date=13 February 2014}}</ref> He is a three-time winner of the [[National Union of Professional Footballers]] (UNFP) [[Trophées UNFP du football#Goalkeeper of the Year|Ligue 1 Goalkeeper of the Year]] award.
Lloris began his career with hometown club [[OGC Nice]], made his debut as a teenager in October 2005 and started in goal during the team's run to the [[2006 Coupe de la Ligue Final]]. After excelling at the club for three seasons, Lloris moved to seven-time [[Ligue 1]] champions Olympique Lyonnais, amid interest from several other clubs, notably [[A.C. Milan|Milan]]. Lloris won several domestic awards in his first season with Lyon and, in his second season, earned award nominations at European level for his performances in the [[UEFA Champions League]], which saw Lyon reach the semi-finals for the first time.
Lloris is a [[France national football team|French international]] having represented his nation at [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[France national under-19 football team|under-19]], and [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]] level. Prior to playing at senior level, he played on the under-19 team that won the [[2005 European Under-19 Football Championship]]. Lloris made his senior international debut in November 2008 in a [[Exhibition match|friendly]] against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. He helped France qualify for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] and was applauded by the media for his performance over two legs against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Second Round|qualifying playoffs]]. He captained the national team for the first time in 2010, and became first-choice captain on 28 February 2012, leading France into the quarter-finals of both [[Euro 2012]] and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], runners-up at [[Euro 2016]], and winners at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Early and personal life== Lloris was born on 26 December 1986 in the [[Southern France|Mediterranean]] city of [[Nice]] to an upper-class family. His mother was a lawyer and his father is a [[Monte Carlo]]-based banker of [[Pays Catalan|Catalan]] descent.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lesechos.fr/22/06/2012/LesEchos/21211-189-ECH_hugo-lloris.htm |title=Hugo Lloris |date=22 June 2012 |accessdate=2 April 2015 |work=Les Échos}}</ref><ref name ="hugo_lloris">{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/feature?id=673250&cc=5901 |title=Champions League 2009–10, Group E |date=11 September 2009 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.philippebilger.com/blog/2010/04/hugo-lloris-un-dernier-rempart.html |title=Hugo Lloris: un dernier rempart |date=2 April 2010 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |publisher=Philippe Bilger |language=French}}</ref> He has a younger brother, [[Gautier Lloris|Gautier]], who currently plays as a [[Defender (association football)|central defender]] for his older brother's former club [[OGC Nice]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/gautier-lloris-sur-les-traces-de-son-frere-08-03-2011-1348292.php |title=Gautier Lloris sur les traces de son frère |date=8 March 2011 |accessdate=31 October 2012 |work=[[Le Parisien]] |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://cote-d-azur.france3.fr/info/nice-en-finale-de-la-coupe-gambardella-a-paris-73609914.html |title=Nice en finale de la Coupe Gambardella à Paris |date=25 April 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2012 |work=France 3 |language=French}}</ref> In 2008, while Lloris was playing for Nice, his mother died. Just two days after her death, he gained national respect for his refusal of a [[Grief|bereavement]] leave offer from manager [[Frédéric Antonetti]], instead opting to play in a league match for Nice.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story?id=773826&sec=uefachampionsleague&root=uefachampionsleague&cc=5901 |title=Lloris the key for Lyon's hopes |date=20 April 2010 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}</ref> Lloris performed admirably in the match despite the circumstances. As a youth, like his international and club teammate [[Yoann Gourcuff]], Lloris excelled at tennis and played the sport up until the age of 13. He was among the top players in his age group, ranking high in the country's national standings before opting to focus on football.<ref name ="hugo_lloris" />
On 10 August 2010, Lloris was named, alongside international teammate [[Karim Benzema]], to appear on the cover of the French version of ''[[FIFA 11]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.info-utiles.fr/modules/news/article.php?storyid=4182 |title=EA-Sport signe Hugo LLoris pour FiFa 11 |date=10 August 2010 |accessdate=10 August 2010 |publisher=Info Utiles |language=French}}</ref> On 23 September 2010, he announced the birth of his daughter.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.olweb.fr/fr/Actualites-sportives/100005/En-bref/54197/Carnet-rose |title=Carnet rose |date=23 September 2010 |accessdate=23 September 2010 |publisher=[[Olympique Lyonnais]] |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721014409/http://www.olweb.fr/fr/Actualites-sportives/100005/En-bref/54197/Carnet-rose |archivedate=21 July 2011 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
On 24 August 2018, Lloris was charged with [[Driving under the influence|drink-driving]] after being stopped by police in west London.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45297105 |title=Hugo Lloris: Tottenham goalkeeper charged with drink-driving |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2018 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> Lloris later pleaded guilty at [[Westminster Magistrates' Court]] and admitted to being more than twice the drink-drive limit. He was fined £50,000 and banned from driving for 20 months.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-london-45482366 |title=Hugo Lloris admits drink-driving charge |date=2018-09-12 |work=BBC News|access-date=2018-09-12 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== Lloris began his football career at age six playing at CEDAC (Centre de Diffusion et d'Action Culturelle), a local [[cultural center]] based in the neighborhood of [[Cimiez]], Nice.<ref name ="deux_garçons">{{cite web |url=http://www.staderennais.com/index.php?rb=22&id=AT2539 |title=Pouplin – Lloris : Deux garçons pleins d'avenir |date=8 March 2007 |accessdate=22 April 2010 |publisher=[[Stade Rennais F.C.]] |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cedac-nice.com/presentation-CIMIEZ.html |title=Présentation du CEDAC Cimiez |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=CEDAC Cimiez |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100409081208/http://www.cedac-nice.com/presentation-CIMIEZ.html |archivedate=9 April 2010}}</ref> The centre offered a variety of activities, which included football. Lloris played a variety of positions at the centre, such as [[Striker (association football)|in the attack]], before switching to the goalkeeper position after coaches noticed that he possessed impressive goalkeeping qualities, such as ball-handling and catching skills.<ref name ="deux_garçons" /> Lloris excelled at the position and caught the attention of former [[OGC Nice]] [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] and French international [[Dominique Baratelli]], who recommended that the player join his former club. At the age of ten, Lloris joined Nice's youth academy.<ref name ="deux_garçons" /> He spent several years in the club's youth academy and was the starting goalkeeper for the club's under-17 team that won the 2003–04 edition of the ''Championnat Nationaux des 18 ans'', a country-wide domestic league competition for players under the age of 18.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ogcnissa.com/fr.php?Rubrique=articles&id_art=1916 |title=Bilan des 18 ans Nationaux |date=22 May 2004 |accessdate=22 March 2011 |publisher=OGC Nissa |language=French}}</ref>
===Nice=== [[File:Hugo Lloris.JPG|thumb|175px|left|Lloris in 2005 with [[OGC Nice|Nice]]]] After success with the club's under-18 team, Lloris was promoted to the club's reserve team in the [[Championnat de France amateur]], the fourth level of French football, for the 2004–05 season. He alternated the starting goalkeeper spot with Hilaire Munoz as he appeared in 12 matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.stat2foot.com/nopclubs/nice20405.htm |title=O.G.C. Nice Reserve Pro: Saison Football 2004/2005 |accessdate=22 March 2011 |publisher=Stat2Foot |language=French |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20120617133052/http://www.stat2foot.com/nopclubs/nice20405.htm |archive-date= 17 June 2012 |dead-url= yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Lloris was promoted to the first team squad ahead of the [[2005–06 Ligue 1|2005–06 season]] and assigned the number 1 shirt. He was designated by manager [[Frédéric Antonetti]] as the team's starting goalkeeper for the club's [[Coupe de la Ligue]] campaign ahead of fan-favourite (and fellow Nice native) [[Damien Gregorini]], who was relied more upon in league play. Lloris made his professional debut on 25 October 2005, at the age of 18, recording a clean sheet in Nice's 2–0 Coupe de la Ligue win over [[LB Châteauroux|Châteauroux]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50478 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120711075823/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50478 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 11 July 2012 |title=Nice v. Châteauroux Match Report |date=25 October 2005 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref> He recorded another clean sheet the following round against [[CS Sedan Ardennes|Sedan]] and helped Nice upset favorites [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] and [[Derby de la Côte d'Azur]] rivals [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the quarter-finals and semi-finals respectively, meaning the club had reached its first-ever Coupe de la Ligue final.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50479 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120710212447/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50479 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 10 July 2012 |title=Nice v. Sedan Match Report |date=20 December 2005 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50455 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120716115209/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50455 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 16 July 2012 |title=Nice v. Bordeaux Match Report |date=17 January 2006 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50454 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120710120604/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50454 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 10 July 2012 |title=Monaco v. Nice Match Report |date=7 February 2006 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref> In [[Coupe de la Ligue Final 2006|the final]], Lloris played the entire match in the club's 2–1 defeat against [[AS Nancy|Nancy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50494 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120716131059/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/50494 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 16 July 2012 |title=Nancy v. Nice Match Report |date=22 April 2006 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref>
Lloris made his league debut on 18 March 2006 against Nancy picking up a [[clean sheet]] in a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/49927 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120712074225/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/49927 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 12 July 2012 |title=Nice v. Nancy Match Report |date=18 March 2006 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel}}</ref> He made four more league appearances that season. The [[2006–07 Ligue 1|following season]], Lloris was given the starting job permanently ahead of Gregorini, who subsequently departed the club for Nancy. Lloris appeared in all but one league match recording 13 clean sheets as Nice finished in 16th place. Despite the disappointing finish, the club was the fifth-best defensive team in the league with Lloris conceding only 36 goals. Only veterans [[Grégory Coupet]], [[Cédric Carrasso]] and [[Ulrich Ramé]] conceded fewer. For the early part of the [[2007–08 Ligue 1|2007–08 season]], Lloris endured a recurring ligament injury in his left knee, which forced him to miss three weeks in September. He returned to the team on 6 October 2007 in a league match against [[Le Mans FC|Le Mans]], but was substituted out after 71 minutes after the injury relapsed.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eurosport.fr/football/ligue-1/2007-2008/lloris-le-bout-du-tunnel_sto1387435/story.shtml |title=Lloris le bout du tunnel |date=24 November 2007 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |publisher=Eurosport |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51340 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120712112513/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51340 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=12 July 2012 |title=Le Mans v. Nice Match Report |date=6 October 2007 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref> Lloris missed a further six weeks before returning on 24 November in the team's 2–1 victory over [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51400 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120730080620/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51400 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=30 July 2012 |title=Nice v. Paris SG Match Report |date=24 November 2007 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |language=French}}</ref> He appeared consistently with the team for the rest of the season as Nice finished in 8th place, the club's best finish in the league since finishing 6th in the [[1988–89 French Division 1|1988–89 season]]. Lloris conceded only 24 goals in his 30 appearances recording 13 clean sheets. He contributed to a defense that only conceded 30 overall during the season, tied for the league-best. Lloris' efforts that season led to him being approached by several big European clubs with hopes of signing him for the future.
===Lyon=== After another solid season with Nice, speculation arose as to where Lloris would play the following season. He was primarily linked to French club [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], who wanted him to replace the departing Grégory Coupet, [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], who wanted him to replace the Brazilian [[Dida (footballer, born 1973)|Dida]], and [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], who wanted Lloris to replace [[Paul Robinson (footballer, born 1979)|Paul Robinson]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.soccernews.com/lyon-deny-coupet-rumours/2325/ |title=Lyon deny Coupet rumours |date=23 May 2008 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Soccer News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eyefootball.com/news/5681/Hugo-Lloris-to-AC-Milan/ |title=Hugo Lloris to AC Milan |date=19 May 2008 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Eye Football}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_3622045,00.html |title=Lloris open to Spurs talks |date=28 May 2008 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[Sky Sports]]}}</ref> After reportedly coming to personal terms with Milan, Lloris snubbed the Italian club for seven-time [[Ligue 1]] champions Lyon. Milan vice president [[Adriano Galliani]] later declared that an agreement had been all but reached stating that Lloris was "practically ours", but the deal reached a stumbling block when Milan goalkeeper [[Christian Abbiati]] refused a move to [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fantasysp.com/player/scr/Adriano_/884150 |title=AC Milan chief Galliani: We had deal for Lyon keeper Lloris |date=12 April 2010 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Fantasy SP |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710224135/http://www.fantasysp.com/player/scr/Adriano_/884150 |archivedate=10 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.footballpress.net/?action=read&idsel=57835 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100418174917/http://www.footballpress.net/?action=read&idsel=57835 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=18 April 2010 |title=Galliani: "We were about to sign Lloris, but..." |date=13 April 2010 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Football Press}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/?action=read&id=202355 |title=Milan, Galliani: "Lloris era nostro ma..." |date=12 April 2010 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian}}</ref> Lloris explained his decision citing Lyon's [[UEFA Champions League|European]] ambitions, more playing time at Lyon, and in Milan, he was not guaranteed the starting goalkeeper spot.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12874_3626358,00.html |title=Lloris explains Lyon choice |date=29 May 2008 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[Sky Sports]]}}</ref> The transfer fee was initially undisclosed, but was later discovered to be priced at €8.5 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12967_3645154,00.html |title=Lloris fills Lyon void |date=3 June 2008 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[Sky Sports]]}}</ref> He was promptly handed the number 1 shirt and also the starting goalkeeper position.
====2008–09 season==== Lloris made his club debut in the team's opening league match of the [[2008–09 Ligue 1|2008–09 season]] on 10 August 2008 against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]]. Lyon won the match 3–0 win giving the goalkeeper his first career clean sheet with the club.<ref name="Lyon v. Toulouse Match Report">{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52261 |title=Lyon v. Toulouse Match Report |date=9 August 2008 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120912115516/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52261 |archivedate=12 September 2012}}</ref> In the following three matches, Lloris earned clean sheets against [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] and regional rivals [[Grenoble Foot 38|Grenoble]] and [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]].<ref name="Lyon v. Toulouse Match Report"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52276 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120710180107/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52276 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=10 July 2012 |title=Lorient v. Lyon Match Report |date=17 August 2008 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52288 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120710145955/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52288 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=10 July 2012 |title=Saint-Étienne v. Lyon Match Report |date=23 August 2008 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French}}</ref> Despite Lyon losing out on the title for the first time in seven years, he finished the campaign conceding only 27 goals in the league and recording 16 clean sheets; both of which were second-best to only Cédric Carrasso. Lloris was, subsequently, named the league's [[Trophées UNFP du football#Goalkeeper of the Year|top goalkeeper]] and also named to the [[Trophées UNFP du football#2009|Team of the Year]]. [[File:Hugo Lloris 2010.jpg|160px|thumb|right|Lloris signing autographs in 2010]]
====2009–10 season==== In the [[2009–10 Ligue 1|2009–10 season]], Lloris remained the club's first-choice goalkeeper and opened the new campaign by recording four clean sheets in the club's first eight matches. For his performances in the month of September, he was awarded the [[UNFP Player of the Month]] becoming the first goalkeeper since [[Steve Mandanda]] in August 2008 to receive the award. Lloris earned media praise for his performances against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the [[UEFA Champions League]]. In the first match, played at [[Anfield]], Lloris made four saves holding Liverpool to only one goal. Lyon won the match 2–1. In the second match at the [[Stade Gerland]], he produced stops from shots by [[Fernando Torres]], [[Dirk Kuyt]] and [[Andriy Voronin]] in the first half, then displayed reflexes to deny the Brazilian [[Lucas Leiva|Lucas]] midway through the second period. Though Lyon conceded late, the team drew the match 1–1 with a goal from [[Lisandro López]] in [[injury time]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1128744.html |title=Lyon delight, Liverpool despair |date=4 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[FIFA|Fédération Internationale de Football Association]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000028/match=2000413/index.html |title=Lyon through as Liverpool teeter |date=4 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]]}}</ref>
On 8 November 2009, Lloris, alongside Marseille and France's number two goalkeeper [[Steve Mandanda]], each conceded five goals in a [[Choc des Olympiques#Notable matches|thrilling 5–5 draw]] between Lyon and Marseille, though most of the goals conceded were attributed to "slack defending" displayed by both clubs as described by the media and both managers.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44961 |archive-url= https://archive.is/20120713172345/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44961 |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 13 July 2012 |title=Lyon v. Marseille Match Report |date=8 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French}}</ref><ref name="Reuters">{{cite news |url=http://in.reuters.com/article/sportsNews/idINIndia-43808320091109 |title=Lyon vs. Marseille – The game of the year |date=9 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |agency=Reuters}}</ref> On 20 December, Lloris finished third behind [[Nicolas Anelka]] and [[Yoann Gourcuff]] in voting for the ''[[France Football]]'' 2009 [[France Football#French player of the year|French Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |title=Gourcuff et Blanc décorés |url=http://www.francefootball.fr/FF/breves2009/20091220_114320_gourcuff-et-blanc-decores.html |work=[[France Football]] |date=20 December 2009 |accessdate=21 December 2009 |language=French}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Lloris remained consistent during the 2010 portion of the season conceding only two goals in the club's first four matches of the year with Lyon winning all of them and Lloris picking up two clean sheets. On 16 February, Lloris earned a clean sheet in Lyon's first leg of its [[UEFA Champions League]] knockout round match against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]. Lloris made two saves in the team's 1–0 victory making a finger-tipping save from a deflected [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] shot in the 61st minute and producing a reflex save on a shot from [[Gonzalo Higuaín]] three minutes later to keep Lyon ahead on the scoreline.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/feb/16/lyon-real-madrid-latest-score |title=Lyon v Real Madrid – as it happened! |date=16 February 2010 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |location=London |first=Tom |last=Lutz |work=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportsnetwork.com/merge/tsnform.aspx?c=sportsnetwork&page=soc-cup/news/news.aspx?id=4289941 |title=Rooney, United edge Milan; Lyon stuns Real |date=16 February 2010 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |publisher=Sports Network |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628180806/http://www.sportsnetwork.com/merge/tsnform.aspx?c=sportsnetwork&page=soc-cup%2Fnews%2Fnews.aspx%3Fid%3D4289941 |archivedate=28 June 2011}}</ref> Lyon later achieved qualification to the quarterfinals in the competition after drawing 1–1 in [[Madrid]] with Lloris conceding the opening goal to Cristiano Ronaldo in the sixth minute. It was the goalkeeper's first goal conceded in over 620 minutes. On 2 May, Lloris provided the assist on the game-winning goal scored by [[Michel Bastos]] in Lyon's 1–0 win over [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/45019 |title=Montpellier v. Lyon Match Report |date=2 May 2010 |accessdate=9 May 2010 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313204035/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/45019 |archivedate=13 March 2012}}</ref> A week later, he was named, for the second consecutive season, the UNFP Ligue 1 Goalkeeper of the Year.
====2010–11 season==== Ahead of the [[2010–11 Ligue 1|2010–11 season]], Lloris was nominated for the UEFA Club Goalkeeper of the Year award at the [[UEFA Club Football Awards]], but lost out on the award to [[2010 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League]]-winning keeper [[Júlio César (football goalkeeper, born 1979)|Júlio César]] of [[Inter Milan|Internazionale]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=814888&sec=uefachampionsleague&cc=5901 |title=Inter Milan players lead UEFA award nominations |date=16 August 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010 |publisher=[[ESPN]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/inters-champions-beat-allcomers-at-uefa-club-awards-2063126.html |title=Inter's champions beat all-comers at Uefa club awards |date=27 August 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010 |work=The Independent |location=UK |first=Gordon |last=Tynan}}</ref> In the season, Lloris performed well, despite conceding a career-high 40 goals in the league as Lyon failed to win the league for the third consecutive season. The frustrating season for the club and Lloris himself reached its zenith on 3 April 2011 following the club's 2–2 away draw with Lloris' former club Nice. Despite being up 2–0 heading into injury time, Lyon conceded two goals within two minutes of each other, an [[Éric Mouloungui]] penalty and a goal at the death from [[Renato Civelli]], allowing Nice to leave the match with a draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53938 |title=Nice v. Lyon Match Report |date=3 April 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French}}</ref> Following the conclusion of the match, a disappointed Lloris, who had previously saved a penalty shot in the match, delivered a surprising profanity-laced declaration in the team's locker room, in which he questioned the team's overall performance.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/155516/lloris-hors-de-lui/ |title=Lloris hors de lui |date=3 April 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011 |publisher=[[Radio Monte Carlo|RMC Sport]] |language=French}}</ref> Following the team's 3–0 win over [[RC Lens|Lens]] the following week, in which Lloris earned his first clean sheet in over a month, the goalkeeper reflected on his comments after the Nice match, stating, "It was a human reaction. There was frustration and accumulation and it had to come out. It was intolerable to draw 2–2 when leading 2–0."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53909 |title=Lyon v. Lens Match Report |date=10 April 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011 |publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/156595/lloris-c-etait-intolerable/ |title=Lloris: "C’était intolérable" |date=10 April 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011 |publisher=[[Radio Monte Carlo|RMC Sport]] |language=French}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== [[File:LlorisChelsea 3 Spurs 0 (15929521516).jpg|thumbnail|Lloris making a save for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] in 2014]]
====2012–13 season==== Lloris signed for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 31 August 2012 for €10 million and €5 million variable. Lyon also receives 20% of Lloris's future transfer profit.<ref>{{cite web |title=Spurs land Lloris |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11675/8038914/Spurs-land-Lloris |work=skysports.com |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 August 2012 |accessdate=31 August 2012}}</ref><ref>http://www.actusnews.com/documents_communiques/ACTUS-0-29249-cp-ol-groupe-100912.pdf</ref> He made his debut for Spurs in a [[UEFA Europa League]] match against [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] on 20 September 2012, the result of the match was 0–0.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19582546 |title=Tottenham v Lazio |date=20 September 2012 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=20 September 2012}}</ref> Lloris started his first [[Premier League]] game against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 7 October 2012, keeping a clean sheet in a 2–0 home victory. His appearance ended fellow Tottenham goalkeeper [[Brad Friedel]]'s run of 310 consecutive games in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19776296 |title=Tottenham 2–0 Aston Villa |date=7 October 2012 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |last=Magowan |first=Alistair |accessdate=17 November 2012}}</ref> After conceding only four goals in six games, he was nominated for the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for December 2012, but lost out to Manchester United's [[Robin van Persie]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Robin van Persie and Andre Villas-Boas win Barclays' December awards |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2012-13/jan/robin-van-persie-andre-villas-boas-win-december-awards.html |publisher=Premier League Website |date=11 January 2013 |accessdate=13 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130623141629/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2012-13/jan/robin-van-persie-andre-villas-boas-win-december-awards.html |archivedate=23 June 2013}}</ref> Lloris ended the 2012–13 season with 25 appearances and 9 clean sheets.
====2013–14 season==== Following speculation linking him with a move to Monaco, Lloris insisted he had left Lyon to play abroad.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tottenham keeper Lloris rejects talk of Monaco move |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2892/transfer-zone/2013/06/09/4037136/tottenham-keeper-lloris-rejects-talk-of-monaco-move |publisher=Goal.com |date=9 June 2013 |accessdate=13 July 2013}}</ref> On 3 November 2013, in a match against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], Lloris lost consciousness in a collision with [[Romelu Lukaku]]'s knee, but remained in the game after manager [[André Villas-Boas]] determined he "showed great character and personality".<ref name=HeadInjury>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur/10424291/Tottenham-Hotspur-accused-of-irresponsible-and-cavalier-attitude-for-letting-Hugo-Lloris-play-with-head-injury.html |title=Tottenham Hotspur accused of 'irresponsible and cavalier attitude' for letting Hugo Lloris play with head injury |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=4 November 2013 |accessdate=1 September 2014}}</ref> The decision was heavily criticised by head injury charities, [[FIFA]] and the players' union, [[FIFPro]].<ref name=HeadInjury/>
Lloris signed a five-year contract extension in July 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28242185 |title=Hugo Lloris: Tottenham goalkeeper signs five-year contract extension |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 July 2014 |accessdate=1 September 2014}}</ref> He said that [[Mauricio Pochettino]], the new manager at Tottenham, had convinced him to sign the new contract with his "rigour and vision" that gave the club "new benchmarks".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/01/hugo-lloris-tottenham-hotspur-captain-liverpool |title=Hugo Lloris: a quiet Spurs captain who does not need to shout to be a leader |first=Paul |last=Doyle |work=The Guardian |date=1 April 2016}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== In a [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League group stage]] match on 23 October 2014, Tottenham were leading [[Asteras Tripolis F.C.|Asteras Tripoli]] 5–0 with four minutes to play when Lloris was sent off for a professional foul on [[Tasos Tsokanis]]. As the team had used all three substitutes, forward [[Harry Kane]] was forced into goal and conceded a goal from a freekick in the 89th minute; Tottenham won the match 5–1.<ref name="Asteras Tripoli">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29730663 |title=A hat-trick from Harry Kane helped Tottenham thrash Greek side Asteras Tripolis and saunter to a first win in the Europa League group-stage. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=23 October 2014}}</ref> Tottenham progressed through the League Cup to face Chelsea in the final at Wembley. Lloris was named in the starting eleven in the hopes of getting silverware but Tottenham lost 2–1.<ref name="leaguecupfinal">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572594 |title=Chelsea 2 – 1 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 March 2015 |author=Phil McNulty |accessdate=24 September 2017}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== In August 2015, Tottenham manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]] named Lloris permanent [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the team, replacing the outgoing [[Younès Kaboul]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/sport/soccer/english-soccer/hugo-lloris-appointed-tottenham-hotspur-captain-1.2317749 |title=Hugo Lloris appointed Tottenham Hotspur captain |work=Irish Times}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== In a [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League group stage]] match (which ended in a 0–0 draw) against [[Bayer Leverkusen]] on 18 October 2016, Lloris made a string of fine saves, including a spectacular one-handed stop on the goal-line to deny [[Javier Hernández]]; Tottenham's manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]] described Lloris's performance in the second half as "brilliant".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/tottenham-hotspur/story/2975821/brilliant-hugo-lloris-to-thank-for-tottenhams-draw-mauricio-pochettino |title='Brilliant' Hugo Lloris to thank for Tottenham's draw – Pochettino |publisher=ESPN FC |date=19 October 2016}}</ref> On 22 November 2016, Lloris saved [[Radamel Falcao]]'s 11th-minute penalty and pulled off multiple world-class saves, including incredibly tipping [[Kamil Glik]]'s powerful volley from five metres out over the bar in the 68th minute, in their 2016–17 UEFA Champions League group stage match away at [[AS Monaco]]; however Tottenham lost the match 1–2 and were eliminated from the competition.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/hugo-lloris-tells-tottenham-to-find-the-solution-ahead-of-chelsea-clash-after-their-champions-league-a3402531.html |title=Hugo Lloris tells Tottenham to ‘find the solution’ ahead of Chelsea clash after their Champions League exit to Monaco |work=London Evening Standard |date=23 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/101ggvideos/save-season-hugo-lloris-makes-unbelievable-point-blank-save-monaco-v-spurs-video/ |title=Back in the Europa League again (Video) |publisher=101 Great Goals |date=22 November 2016}}</ref>
In December 2016, Lloris signed a contract extension to remain at Tottenham until 2022.<ref>{{cite web |title=Hugo Lloris extends contract with Tottenham Hotspur until 2022 |url=http://www.espnfc.us/tottenham-hotspur/story/3025012/hugo-lloris-extends-contract-with-tottenham-hotspur-until-2022 |publisher=[[ESPN FC]] |author=Dan Kilpatrick |date=22 December 2016 |accessdate=22 December 2016}}</ref> In the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]], Lloris helped Tottenham achieve the best defensive record in the club's history, conceding only 26 goals in the Premier League this season (only 9 of which were conceded in home league games), 6 better than the previous record of 32 conceded that was set in the [[1908–09 in English football|1908–09 season]] in the [[Football League Second Division|Second Division]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/2016-17-in-numbers-few-goals-conceded-020617/ |title=2016–17 in Numbers – New Defensive Records |date=2 June 2017 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.}}</ref> He kept 15 clean sheets this season, but missed out on the [[Premier League Golden Glove|Golden Glove]] award when a goal was conceded in the last game of the season, a record-breaking 7–1 away league win at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-squad-devastated-for-hugo-lloris-despite-recordbreaking-campaign-says-kieran-trippier-a3545471.html |title=Tottenham squad 'devastated' for Hugo Lloris despite record-breaking campaign, says Kieran Trippier |first=Tom |last=Collomosse |date=22 May 2017 |work=The Evening Standard}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== On 17 April 2018, Lloris made his 250th appearance for Tottenham in a 1–1 draw with [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]]. In doing so, he became only the 61st player, and sixth goalkeeper to achieve the milestone for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/hugo-lloris-and-the-250-club-190418/ |title=Hugo and our 250 club |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur |date=19 April 2018 |accessdate=20 April 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Hugo Lloris Euro 2012 v2.jpg|thumb|160px|left|Lloris playing for France at UEFA Euro 2012.]] Lloris has been active on the international front with [[France national football team|France]], first appearing with the [[France national under-18 football team|under-18 team]] making his debut on 11 March 2004 in a [[Exhibition match|friendly match]] against [[Germany national under-18 football team|Germany]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m18ans/112954.shtml |title=Un bon résultat nul face à l'Allemagne (1–1) |date=11 March 2004 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |publisher=[[French Football Federation]] |language=French}}</ref> He later played with the [[France national under-19 football team|under-19 team]] and was part of the winning team at the [[2005 European Under-19 Football Championship]]. Lloris appeared in all five matches the team played in the competition. He made only five appearances with the [[France national under-21 football team|under-21 team]], primarily because of his commitments to the senior team. On 11 October 2008, with the under-21 squad attempting to qualify for the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]], coach [[Erick Mombaerts]] called up Lloris to the team for their important two-legged playoff against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]], despite him having been called up to the senior team and the player having last played for the team in August 2007. Lloris honored the call up and started the second leg. With France seconds away from a spot in the tournament, because of the team's 1–1 draw in the first leg, Germany got a late goal from [[Benedikt Höwedes]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fff.fr/servfff/fiche_joueur_new/match.php?id_match=41 |title=France v. Germany Match Report |date=15 October 2008 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |publisher=[[French Football Federation]] |language=French}}</ref> The 1–0 loss eliminated France from the competition and also ended Lloris's under-21 career.
Lloris received his first call-up to the senior national team for France's 6 February 2008 match against [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. However, he instead played for [[France B national football team|the B team]] in their friendly match against the [[Congo DR national football team|Congo DR]], held the day before the Spain friendly. After receiving several more call ups in 2008, he finally earned his first cap on 19 November 2008 in a 0–0 draw with [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. On 9 September 2009, Lloris received his first international [[Penalty card|red card]], against [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]], following a foul on [[Nikola Žigić]] in the penalty box, despite replays showing otherwise.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ten-man France rouse to deny Serbia |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/worldcup/fixturesresults/round=15218/match=302415/index.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120708044400/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/worldcup/fixturesresults/round=15218/match=302415/index.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=8 July 2012 |work=[[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] |date=9 September 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010}}</ref> Lloris returned to the team on 14 October playing the entire 90 minutes in the team's 3–1 win over [[Austria national football team|Austria]].
Lloris was applauded by the media and players, alike, for his performance over two legs against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] that saw France earn a spot in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] finals. Former national team goalkeeper Grégory Coupet credited his performance as "phenomenal", while the French media described him as "Saint Lloris", which is a play on the nickname of Real Madrid counterpart [[Iker Casillas]], who was considered one of the top goalkeepers in Europe at the time.<ref>{{cite news |title=Coupet hails "phenomenal" Lloris |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=699655&cc=5901 |publisher=[[ESPN]] |date=17 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Les Bleus avec Saint Lloris et sans Gourcuff |url=http://fr.fifa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1136808.html |work=[[FIFA|Fédération Internationale de Football Association]] |date=18 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091121045207/http://fr.fifa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1136808.html |archivedate=21 November 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Saint Lloris, Priez pour nous |url=http://www.football365.fr/france/equipe-de-france/article_362596_france-eire-la-performance-des-bleus-Saint-Lloris-priez-pour-nous-.shtml |work=Football 365 |date=18 November 2009 |accessdate=16 April 2010 |language=French}}</ref>
On 11 May 2010, Lloris was named in Domenech's 30-man preliminary squad to participate in the 2010 World Cup, later being named to the final 23-man team and installed as first-choice goalkeeper. On 11 June 2010, Lloris made his [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] finals debut in the team's opening group stage match against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]], earning a clean sheet in a 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=Uruguay 0–0 France |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_02/default.stm |publisher=BBC |date=11 June 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011}}</ref> Lloris appeared in both of France's other group stage matches, against [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] and hosts [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]]. Against South Africa, Lloris committed a goalkeeping error which resulted in the opening goal for the hosts. He redeemed himself later in the match, however, by producing several saves to limit the South Africans' chances of progressing to the knockout rounds. France lost the match 2–1, which resulted in the hosts' elimination from the competition.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2010: France v South Africa – as it happened |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/22/world-cup-2010-france-south-africa-live |work=[[Guardian Media Group]] |date=22 June 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |location=London |first=Paul |last=Doyle}}</ref>
[[File:Lloris Torres and Koscielny Sweden-France Euro 2012.jpg|right|thumb|240px|Lloris (left) saves a shot from [[Spain national football team|Spain]]'s [[Fernando Torres]] at [[UEFA Euro 2012]].]] [[File:France WC2018 final.jpg|thumb|240px|left|Lloris (top right), lining up with France during the [[2018 FIFA World Cup Final]].]] On 17 November 2010, Lloris [[Captain (association football)|captained]] France, for the first time, in the team's 2–1 victory over [[England national football team|England]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |title=England v France player ratings |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/england-v-france-player-ratings-2137552.html?action=Gallery&ino=13 |work=The Independent |location=UK |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011}}</ref> After leading France out six more times on an interim basis, on 28 February 2012, he was named first-choice captain of the national team by manager [[Laurent Blanc]] ahead of [[UEFA Euro 2012]]. Lloris started for his country in the final tournament, as they reached the quarter-finals, where they were eliminated following a 2–0 loss to eventual champions Spain.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/spain/9344376/Spain-2-France-0-match-report.html |title=Spain 2 France 0: match report |publisher=The Telegraph |author1=Mark Ogden |date=23 June 2012 |accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref>
He started for France at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], helping the team to the quarter-finals, where they were defeated 1–0 by eventual champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/04/france-germany-world-cup-2014-quarter-final-match-report |title=Germany reach World Cup semi-finals as Mats Hummels header sinks France |publisher=The Guardian |author1=David Hytner |date=4 July 2014 |accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref>
Lloris was the starting goalkeeper of the French squad that reached the [[UEFA Euro 2016 Final|final]] of [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] on home soil, only to be defeated 1–0 by [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] in extra time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000451/match=2017907/index.html |title=Portugal 1–0 France |publisher=UEFA |first1=Joseph |last1=Walker |first2=David |last2=Crossan |date=10 July 2016 |accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref>
On 2 June 2017, Lloris made his 88th appearance for France in a 5–0 friendly home win over [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]], overtaking [[Fabien Barthez]] as his nation's most capped goalkeeper of all time.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/griezmann-and-france-hit-strong-rhythm-ahead-of-england-friendly-in-paris-gr3h9k62r |title=Griezmann and France hit strong rhythm ahead of England friendly in Paris |publisher=The Sunday Times |author1=Ian Hawkey |date=11 June 2017 |accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/match/402383 |title=France – Paraguay 5–0 |publisher=L'Équipe |language=French |accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref> After beating [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]] and [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]] in October later that year, Hugo Lloris and the France national team [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualified]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lemonde.fr/mondial-2018/article/2017/10/10/coupe-du-monde-2018-les-nations-deja-qualifiees_5199048_5193650.html |title=Football : tous les pays qualifiés pour la Coupe du monde en Russie |first=Clément |last=Martel |date=10 October 2017 |via=Le Monde}}</ref>
On 21 June 2018, Lloris earned his 100th cap in France's 1–0 win over [[Peru national football team|Peru]] in their second group stage game of the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-ae/news/cest-magnifique-lloris-earns-100th-france-cap/1ppe65sstl7eh1tgk9wngdy7qf |title=C'est magnifique! Lloris earns 100th France cap |date=21 June 2018 |via=Goal.com}}</ref> Against Uruguay in the quarter-finals, Lloris made a key save from a [[Martin Caceres]] header as France won 2–0.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/france/478/blog/post/3558079/lloris-wonder-save-earns-8-10-for-france-in-world-cup-win-over-uruguay |title=Lloris' wonder save earns 8/10 for France in World Cup win over Uruguay |last=Johnson |first=Jonathan |work=ESPN |date=6 July 2018 |accessdate=23 July 2018}}</ref> On 15 July, he lifted the [[FIFA World Cup Trophy|World Cup trophy]] as his team's captain, as France defeated [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] with a 4–2 victory in the [[2018 World Cup Final|final]], despite his mistake which allowed Croatia's [[Mario Mandžukić]] to score a goal as Lloris tried to dribble past him.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/15/france-croatia-world-cup-final-match-report |title=France seal second World Cup triumph with 4–2 win over brave Croatia |work=The Guardian |accessdate=16 July 2018}}</ref>
On 17 November 2018, he made a record of 9 saves in a [[UEFA Nations League]] game against [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]], which France lost 0–2.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2806470-hugo-lloris-frances-2-0-loss-could-have-been-more-flattering-for-netherlands |title=Hugo Lloris: France's 2-0 Loss Could Have Been 'More Flattering' for Netherlands |last=Sunderland |first=Tom |work=Bleacher Report|access-date=2018-11-18 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/this-is-a-huge-step-koeman-surprised-as-netherlands-dominate/1p1twsf4lwbwo1kkr0vy1kb077 |title=Netherlands 2-0 France: Ronald Koeman surprised as the Dutch dominate the world champions {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=2018-11-18|language=en}}</ref>
